clinical_study.brief_title: Changing Habits and Lifestyles in Older Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: Changing Habits and Lifestyles in Older Individuals

brief_summary.textblock: This is an intervention study, aiming to increase protein intake, by increasing egg consumption in community dwelling older adults aged 55 years and over, by providing recipes to increase flavour and variety in egg dishes.

detailed_description.textblock: Individuals will be randomized to either receive the intervention or to a control group, where the intervention group will receive 6 recipes every two weeks for a 12 week period, and at the start, after 12 weeks and after 6 months egg intake, protein intake, body protein status, and various functional measures of muscle function will be assessed in both intervention and control group.

primary_outcome.description: Change in egg intake over the intervention period, assessed using an adapted Food Frequency Questionnaire (FFQ)
Self-declared adverse events over the intervention period, assessed by questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: Change in dietary protein intake over the intervention and follow-up period, assessed using an adapted FFQ
Change in muscle function over the intervention and follow-up period, assessed using various functional tests
Change in lean body mass over the intervention and follow-up period, assessed using bioimpedance
Change in egg intake over the follow-up period, assessed using an adapted FFQ.
Self-declared adverse events over the follow-up period, assessed by questionnaire

arm_group.description: 6 recipes will be sent by post every 2 weeks for a 12 week period. Dietary recommendations will also be provided at the start of the intervention period to increase the relevance of the recipes.
Dietary recommendations will be provided at the start of the study period, such that the intervention regards the recipes, not the recommendations

intervention.description: 6 recipes will be provided every 2 weeks by post for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Individuals can be considered for inclusion if they meet the following inclusion criteria:
- being over 55 years old
- living in the community
- being able to give consent
- not being allergic to eggs
- not suffering from known renal insufficiency, or having a pacemaker or defibrillator.
- not suffering from known hypercholesterolaemia, or known familial hypercholesterolaemia.
- not having undergone chemotherapy or radiotherapy in the last 6 months
- not suffering from any condition, or receiving medication or treatment that the participants feel affects their eating or sense of flavour.
- being able to perform the physical performance tests (e.g. walk, sit on a chair)
- being able to read and understand English
